column4: Has anyone had any experience getting a USB device to work over an IP network?  for example, i have a program i've written that allows me to control my robot via usb joystick, but when I use my robot, I'd rather not have to rely on the wired usb connection to control it.  ideally i could run my program on the robot, but use something that makes the usb driver detect the joystick connected to another computer on the network
ive seen mention of some usb-over ip drivers.
you may want to use a Upstart type script,     in /etc/init/  and not use the sysv method.
